intro: Monnina guatemalensis, commonly known as Mexican bluestem, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, blue to purple flowers appear in clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits that are dispersed by wind. Monnina guatemalensis is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, pointed leaves.
